abstract: Former News of the World deputy editor Neil Wallis is acquitted of charges of conspiracy to hack telephones between 2003 and 2006.
lead_paragraph: Neil Wallis, 64, the former deputy editor of The News of the World, a Rupert Murdoch paper, was acquitted of charges of conspiracy to hack telephones.

headline.main: Ex-Editor Is Acquitted in British Phone Hacking Scandal
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Britain: Editor Cleared in Hacking Case

snippet: Neil Wallis, 64, the former deputy editor of The News of the World, a Rupert Murdoch paper, was acquitted of charges of conspiracy to hack telephones.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
